results.name: Permutation of nonnegative integers: map each number by lengths of runs in its binary representation to the number in whose once left-shifted Zeckendorf representation occurs the same run lengths (in the same order) as the lengths of consecutive blocks of zeros.
comment: See the comments at the inverse permutation A227351 where the idea behind this mapping is explained.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: Moreover, this permutation effects the following correspondences:
